byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Federal appeals court overturns 5 of 18 convictions of former Illinois Gov Rod R Blagojevich on technical grounds; overturned corruption charges include his attempt to sell or trade United States Senate seat of Pres Barack Obama; decision is not likely to reduce Blagojevich's 14-year prison sentence.
lead_paragraph: Five of the 18 convictions against the former governor of Illinois were quashed on appeal Tuesday, and his prison sentence was also vacated.

headline.main: Court Overturns Some of Rod Blagojevich’s Convictions
headline.print_headline: Court Overturns 5 of 18 Convictions of Illinois Governor Sentenced for Graft

snippet: Five of the 18 convictions against the former governor of Illinois were quashed on appeal Tuesday, and his prison sentence was also vacated.
